decks.notes: The deck focuses on using efficient removal spells and disrupting the opponent's hand through discard spells in order to clear the way for aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tasigur. It also aims to generate card advantage and bonus value through cards like Tireless Tracker and Scavenging Ooze. The combination of powerful creatures, removal spells, and disruptive elements allows the deck to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board state, making it a formidable force in aggressive matchups.

This deck revolves around utilizing the graveyard to quickly fill it up with cards like Stinkweed Imp, Prized Amalgam, and Narcomoeba, then recurring them with cards like Life from the Loam. The goal is to quickly assemble a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells. Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion help dig through the deck to find key pieces, while Creeping Chill provides additional reach and life gain. This deck aims to bury the opponent in card advantage and threats from the graveyard.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards using self-mill effects like Shriekhorn and Faithless Looting, and then use cards like Life from the Loam to bring back key cards like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam. Conflagrate is used as a finishing move to deal massive damage to the opponent. The goal is to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creatures and burn spells before they can set up their own game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards through discard effects like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to cast powerful creatures like Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix for free. It aims to apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Flameblade Adept and Bloodghast while disrupting their game plan with cards like Collective Brutality and Lightning Bolt. The deck utilizes the delve mechanic with cards like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler to efficiently use the graveyard as a resource. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful aggro strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Faithless Looting, allowing you to recur powerful creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Life from the Loam and Creeping Chill, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures and finished them off with cards like Conflagrate. This deck focuses on quickly and efficiently utilizing your graveyard as a resource to create a powerful board presence and win the game in a burst of combo synergy.

The deck focuses on deploying a fast and aggressive board presence of Merfolk creatures, supported by efficient disruption in the form of counterspells and tempo plays. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Spreading Seas to disrupt opponent's mana base, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures boosted by Lords of Atlantis and Master of Waves. The deck's synergy and consistency in deploying threats early in the game allows it to apply pressure and close out the game quickly.

The deck is focused on aggressive gameplay, utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf to apply early pressure on the opponent. Supporting cards like Liliana of the Veil and hand disruption spells such as Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek help control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Assassin's Trophy help deal with threats, while Kolaghan's Command offers flexibility. The deck aims to maintain board presence, disrupt the opponent's plays, and close out the game quickly with powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on countering your opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and controlling the game until you can win with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It utilizes hand disruption, board wipes, land destruction, and card draw to keep the opponent off balance and unable to execute their game plan. Your main win conditions are Celestial Colonnade and powerful late-game control cards like Terminus and Cryptic Command. The deck's strength lies in its ability to outlast and outmaneuver opponents through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

This deck focuses on using counters to pump up creatures and quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Hardened Scales and Metallic Mimic, as well as creatures like Hangarback Walker and Arcbound Ravager, it aims to build a threatening board presence that can deal a lot of damage in a short amount of time. With the help of cards like Walking Ballista and Steel Overseer, this deck can also control the board and handle opposing threats efficiently. Overall, it is a fast-paced and aggressive deck that capitalizes on the power of +1/+1 counters.

The deck focuses on playing efficient hexproof creatures and then loading them up with powerful auras to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Key cards such as Daybreak Coronet and Ethereal Armor can create huge threats that are hard to deal with, especially when combined with Leyline of Sanctity for protection. The goal is to quickly build a strong board presence and push through damage while keeping the creatures safe from removal spells. The deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and difficult to interact with, making it a potent force in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This UR Control deck focuses on countering and removing opponent threats while efficiently drawing cards, with the end goal of transforming Thing in the Ice into Awoken Horror for a powerful win condition. The inclusion of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrade provide additional removal options, while cards like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage provide versatility and control over the game. The deck also utilizes Blood Moon to disrupt opponent mana bases and gain an advantage.

Utilize a combination of mana ramping, disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and removal options to quickly put out powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and big threats. Also, use cards like Expedition Map to search for key lands like Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Tower for additional advantages. It's all about quickly building a board presence and putting pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using human creatures. The deck aims to quickly build up a board presence with cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play and maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the diverse casting costs of the human creatures, ensuring the deck can consistently deploy threats and apply pressure.

The main concept of this Dredge deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Faithless Looting, allowing you to bring back powerful creatures like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. Using cards like Life from the Loam to get lands back and Conflagrate to deal damage, you aim to overwhelm your opponent with graveyard recursion and explosive plays. The deck focuses on using the graveyard as a resource to create a powerful and fast combo that can quickly lead to victory.

This deck heavily focuses on controlling the game by denying the opponent's resources and cards, countering threats, and ultimately winning through card advantage and efficient removal. The key strategy involves using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Jace, along with synergistic cards like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage, to keep the opponent's board in check while drawing into answers and threats. With a solid mana base and a mix of card draw, counterspells, and board wipes, this UW Control deck aims to overpower the opponent in the late game.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells such as Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy to maintain board control. Additionally, the deck includes powerful finishers like Tarmogoyf and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to close out games quickly. Overall, the Golgari Aggro deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, while also having the tools to disrupt the opponent's strategy.
